name: Bury FC History Trivia Game | UK Football Teams | 10 Questions

questions.text: What year were the club formed?
questions.explanation:
1885.

	They were formed as Bury FC and played their first game at Gigg Lane in September of 1885 against Wigan.

questions.text: Who was the first manager in Bury's history?
questions.explanation:
T Hargreaves.

	Hargreaves managed the club for four months between January and May 1887. Hamer then took over for a further ten years, before Montgomery was installed between 1907-15. After Word War I, Cameron took charge until 1923.

The Shakers.

	Then chairman of the club, JT Ingham invented this nickname by stating that Everton would be 'given a shaking', before a Lancashire Senior Cup match.

questions.text: From which club did Bury sign Andy Preece?
questions.explanation:
Blackpool.

	Preece began his career at non-league Evesham in 1987, and subsequently played for Northampton Town, Worcester City, Wrexham, Stockport County, Crystal Palace, Blackpool, and signed for Bury on a free transfer in 1998. He became the club's manager in 1999.

questions.text: Neville Neville was Bury's Commercial Manager in the 1990s, but can you name one of his famous footballing sons?
questions.explanation:
Gary & Phil & Phillip.

	Gary and Phil Neville (o fmnachester United fame) were born in the town, in 1975 and 1977 respectively.

questions.text: Were Bury promoted in their first season in the Football League?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	In season 1894-95, Bury played in the Second Division, and won the championship by 9 points, winning all 15 games at home.

questions.text: Which of these players scored the most goals in a season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Craig Madden.

	Madden scored 35 goals in the 1981-82 Division Four season, and scored 129 goals in total between 1978-86.

questions.text: Who did Bury play in the 1995 Division Three play-off final?
questions.explanation:
Chesterfield.

	A 2-0 victory byr Chesterfield ensured that Bury would remain in Division Three for the following season.

questions.text: Going into the last game of the 1995-96 season, Bury were lying one point adrift of automatic promotion. Who did they play, and consequently beat, that made sure they would play in Division Two the following season?
questions.explanation:
Cardiff City.

	Bury won the game 3-0 at Gigg Lane, while the other two teams that could have been promoted, Plymouth Argyle won 3-0, but were a point behind Bury, and Darlington, who held the promotion spot before the final game, could only manage a 3-3 draw with Scunthorpe United.

questions.text: Who did Bury sell David Johnson to in 1997?
questions.explanation:
Ipswich Town & Ipswich.

	Johnson began his career as a trainee at Manchester United in 1994, and signed for Bury a year later on a free transfer.
